comments.html: UCIF has been trying to address this issue by letting Unified Communications applications request QoS treatment through a well-defined API (http://www.ucif.org/Technology/UCSoftwareDefinedNetworkingUCSDN.aspx). This eliminates the need for the network to apply QoS markings solely based on network-level guesses about application-level information.
comments.name: Chris Lauwers

comments.html:
Ivan, I agree with your concerns about the scaleability of tracking each flow. An alternative method of detecting and marking large flows is to use packet sampling (sFlow) in Open vSwitch, or in the physical top of rack switches to detect the large flows and OpenFlow to insert marking rules. The following article describes the SDN controller:

http://blog.sflow.com/2014/03/performance-optimizing-hybrid-openflow.html
